text:
The Trichy Trekkers would conduct a bicycle expedition for women in the city on March 6 as part of the International Women’s Day celebration. The expedition, on the themes of eco-friendly environment and importance of fitness, will be for a distance of about 30 km.

Participation fee is Rs.200, according to a press release. Registrations can be made online atwww.trichytrekkers.com

Plea to ensure release of water

The Farmers Wing of the Tamil Maanila Congress has urged the State government to ensure the release of at least 2,000 cusecs of water from the Mettur Dam to meet the requirements of the standing crops irrigated through 19 irrigation channels downstream the reservoir and also to meet the drinking water requirements of various towns and cities. In a representation, Puliyur A.Nagarajan, president of the wing, also urged the government to set up seed processing centre and soil research centre at Koyyathoppu in Manikandam union in Tiruchi district.

Assistance distributed

Collector K.S.Palanisamy distributed financial assistance totally worth Rs.2.54 lakhs given by the District Welfare Fund to beneficiaries on Thursday.

He presented a cheque for Rs.50,000 to Sathyaseelan of Neeliyampatti, a second year medical student, who had scored high marks in Plus Two examination, towards his educational expense. He also presented Rs.10,000 to M.Hariharan of Thiruparaithurai who had brought laurels by participating in the national level yoga competition recently.

He handed over a cheque for Rs.1.94 lakhs to the Holy Family Hansenorium, Fathima Nagar, towards maintenance expenses of 27 children.
title: Bicycle expedition for women
